concept.title: Printing in Access
concept.shortdesc: How you can print the content of tables, queries, forms, and reports.

conbody.p: Access allows for printing using the printers that are available in Windows.
Depending on the view in an Access object, the result can be printed. For example, you can print datasheet views at Tables and Queries, report views at reports, and form views at forms.
conbody.note: There is no option for printing the design view, but Access has a tool named Database Documenter with which you can print the design characteristics of database objects.
conbody.p:
The print options are available through File Print . You then have the following options: Print options
Print options in Access
With the choice Print Preview, you can customize the print, such as page size, portrait or landscape, margins, ....
